Pressure washing of stucco surfaces can cause damage to the home. Cleaning is relatively simple for most hard finish type surfaces such as brick, stucco and stone. The following steps may be helpful:

1 - Pre-soak the surfaces.
2 - Using a garden hose, direct water against the wall to loosen the dirt. Always clean from the top down to avoid streaking.
3 - Use a medium stiff bristled brush to loosen tuff stains.
4 - For mineral stains or streaking, purchase mild chemical cleaners specifically formulated for portland cement and stucco applications.
5 - Rinse the wall from the top down again & repeat the steps above if necessary.

Succo may be painted when severe staining occurs. Use of harsh concrete cleaners may cause the delicate stucco surfaces to crack and spiderweb, care should be used when using chemicals to clean stucco. A masonry or paint supplier may be helpful in selecting a cleaner suitable to your needs.
CLEANING
Hairline Cracking (Spiderwebbing)
Hairline cracks are normal in masonry surfaces such as stucco. You should expect to see some cracks develop in areas where door, window and corner trim meet the stucco surfaces. If larger cracks become evident, stucco patch may be purchased to repair these areas. Caution should be used when patching stucco since color will vary. If you are unsure exactly what stucco mix was used originally, a professional should evaluate the situation and recommend a fix that will blend in a uniform manner.

Painting of stucco can remedy any mismatched repair work. Contact a painting specialist in your area to select the proper paint and application for your home.

Large cracking that re-appears (or spiderweb type hairline cracks) may indicate movement in the structure or substrate that the stucco is affixed to. A professional stucco repair company should evaluate this situation.

Spiderwebbing sometimes is an indication of poor working conditions at the time of installation (freezing temperatures, etc.) and may be covered by the builder warranty on new homes. Contact your builder if this occurs within the warranted timeframe.
Cracking of bricks or mortar may indicate failure and should be inspected by a qualified professional.
Weepholes are drainage ports installed under windows, above door headers, and below the finish
floor level of the home. These should never be mistaken as deficiencies and filled with caulk or other materials that would hinder their function.
